verses.verse: If one be <S%H4672>found<s%> <S%H2491>slain<s%> in the <S%H127>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> thee to <S%H3423>possess<s%> it, <S%H5307>lying<s%> in the <S%H7704>field<s%>, and it be not <S%H3045>known<s%> who hath <S%H5221>slain<s%> him:

Then thy <S%H2205>elders<s%> and thy <S%H8199>judges<s%> shall come <S%H3318>forth<s%>, and they shall <S%H4058>measure<s%> unto the <S%H5892>cities<s%> which are round <S%H5439>about<s%> him that is <S%H2491>slain<s%>:

And it shall be, that the <S%H5892>city<s%> which is <S%H7138>next<s%> unto the slain <S%H2491>man<s%>, even the <S%H2205>elders<s%> of that <S%H5892>city<s%> shall <S%H3947>take<s%> an <S%H1241%H5697>heifer<s%>, which hath not been wrought <S%H5647>with<s%>, and which hath not <S%H4900>drawn<s%> in the <S%H5923>yoke<s%>;

And the <S%H2205>elders<s%> of that <S%H5892>city<s%> shall bring <S%H3381>down<s%> the <S%H5697>heifer<s%> unto a <S%H386>rough<s%> <S%H5158>valley<s%>, which is neither <S%H5647>eared<s%> nor <S%H2232>sown<s%>, and shall strike <S%H6202>off<s%> the <S%H5697>heifer's<s%> <S%H6202>neck<s%> there in the <S%H5158>valley<s%>:

And the <S%H3548>priests<s%> the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H3878>Levi<s%> shall come <S%H5066>near<s%>; for them the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> hath <S%H977>chosen<s%> to <S%H8334>minister<s%> unto him, and to <S%H1288>bless<s%> in the <S%H8034>name<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; and by their <S%H6310>word<s%> shall every <S%H7379>controversy<s%> and every <S%H5061>stroke<s%> be tried:

And all the <S%H2205>elders<s%> of that <S%H5892>city<s%>, that are <S%H7138>next<s%> unto the <S%H2491>slain<s%> man, shall <S%H7364>wash<s%> their <S%H3027>hands<s%> over the <S%H5697>heifer<s%> that is <S%H6202>beheaded<s%> in the <S%H5158>valley<s%>:
And they shall <S%H6030>answer<s%> and <S%H559>say<s%>, Our <S%H3027>hands<s%> have not <S%H8210>shed<s%> this <S%H1818>blood<s%>, neither have our <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H7200>seen<s%> it.

Be <S%H3722>merciful<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, unto thy <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, whom thou hast <S%H6299>redeemed<s%>, and <S%H5414>lay<s%> not <S%H5355>innocent<s%> <S%H1818>blood<s%> unto thy <S%H5971>people<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel's<s%> <S%H7130>charge<s%>. And the <S%H1818>blood<s%> shall be <S%H3722>forgiven<s%> them.

So shalt thou put <S%H1197>away<s%> the guilt of <S%H5355>innocent<s%> <S%H1818>blood<s%> from <S%H7130>among<s%> you, when thou shalt <S%H6213>do<s%> that which is <S%H3477>right<s%> in the <S%H5869>sight<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.

¶ When thou goest <S%H3318>forth<s%> to <S%H4421>war<s%> against thine <S%H341>enemies<s%>, and the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> hath <S%H5414>delivered<s%> them into thine <S%H3027>hands<s%>, and thou hast <S%H7617>taken<s%> them <S%H7628>captive<s%>,

And <S%H7200>seest<s%> among the <S%H7633>captives<s%> a <S%H8389%H3303>beautiful<s%> <S%H802>woman<s%>, and hast a <S%H2836>desire<s%> unto her, that thou wouldest have <S%H3947>her<s%> to thy <S%H802>wife<s%>;
Then thou shalt <S%H935>bring<s%> her <S%H8432>home<s%> to thine <S%H1004>house<s%>; and she shall <S%H1548>shave<s%> her <S%H7218>head<s%>, and <S%H6213>pare<s%> her <S%H6856>nails<s%>;

And she shall <S%H5493>put<s%> the <S%H8071>raiment<s%> of her <S%H7628>captivity<s%> from off her, and shall <S%H3427>remain<s%> in thine <S%H1004>house<s%>, and <S%H1058>bewail<s%> her <S%H1>father<s%> and her <S%H517>mother<s%> a <S%H3117>full<s%> <S%H3391>month<s%>: and <S%H310>after<s%> that thou shalt <S%H935>go<s%> in unto her, and be her <S%H1166>husband<s%>, and she shall be thy <S%H802>wife<s%>.

And it shall be, if thou have no <S%H2654>delight<s%> in her, then thou shalt let her <S%H7971>go<s%> whither she <S%H5315>will<s%>; but thou shalt not <S%H4376>sell<s%> her at <S%H4376>all<s%> for <S%H3701>money<s%>, thou shalt not make <S%H6014>merchandise<s%> of her, <S%H834>because<s%> thou hast <S%H6031>humbled<s%> her.

¶ If a <S%H376>man<s%> have <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H802>wives<s%>, <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H157>beloved<s%>, and <S%H259>another<s%> <S%H8130>hated<s%>, and they have <S%H3205>born<s%> him <S%H1121>children<s%>, both the <S%H157>beloved<s%> and the <S%H8130>hated<s%>; and if the <S%H1060>firstborn<s%> <S%H1121>son<s%> be hers that was <S%H8146>hated<s%>:

Then it shall be, <S%H3117>when<s%> he maketh his <S%H1121>sons<s%> to <S%H5157>inherit<s%> that which he hath, that he <S%H3201>may<s%> not make the <S%H1121>son<s%> of the <S%H157>beloved<s%> <S%H1069>firstborn<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H1121>son<s%> of the <S%H8130>hated<s%>, which is indeed the <S%H1060>firstborn<s%>:

But he shall <S%H5234>acknowledge<s%> the <S%H1121>son<s%> of the <S%H8130>hated<s%> for the <S%H1060>firstborn<s%>, by <S%H5414>giving<s%> him a <S%H8147>double<s%> <S%H6310>portion<s%> of all that he <S%H4672>hath<s%>: for he is the <S%H7225>beginning<s%> of his <S%H202>strength<s%>; the <S%H4941>right<s%> of the <S%H1062>firstborn<s%> is his.

¶ If a <S%H376>man<s%> have a <S%H5637>stubborn<s%> and <S%H4784>rebellious<s%> <S%H1121>son<s%>, which will not <S%H8085>obey<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of his <S%H1>father<s%>, or the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of his <S%H517>mother<s%>, and that, when they have <S%H3256>chastened<s%> him, will not <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto them:

Then shall his <S%H1>father<s%> and his <S%H517>mother<s%> lay <S%H8610>hold<s%> on him, and bring him <S%H3318>out<s%> unto the <S%H2205>elders<s%> of his <S%H5892>city<s%>, and unto the <S%H8179>gate<s%> of his <S%H4725>place<s%>;

And they shall <S%H559>say<s%> unto the <S%H2205>elders<s%> of his <S%H5892>city<s%>, This our <S%H1121>son<s%> is <S%H5637>stubborn<s%> and <S%H4784>rebellious<s%>, he will not <S%H8085>obey<s%> our <S%H6963>voice<s%>; he is a <S%H2151>glutton<s%>, and a <S%H5433>drunkard<s%>.

And all the <S%H582>men<s%> of his <S%H5892>city<s%> shall <S%H7275>stone<s%> him with <S%H68>stones<s%>, that he <S%H4191>die<s%>: so shalt thou <S%H1197>put<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H1197>away<s%> from <S%H7130>among<s%> you; and all <S%H3478>Israel<s%> shall <S%H8085>hear<s%>, and <S%H3372>fear<s%>.

¶ And if a <S%H376>man<s%> have committed a <S%H2399>sin<s%> worthy <S%H4941>of<s%> <S%H4194>death<s%>, and he be to be put to <S%H4191>death<s%>, and thou <S%H8518>hang<s%> him on a <S%H6086>tree<s%>:

His <S%H5038>body<s%> shall not remain all <S%H3885>night<s%> upon the <S%H6086>tree<s%>, but thou shalt in any <S%H6912>wise<s%> <S%H6912>bury<s%> him that <S%H3117>day<s%>; (for he that is <S%H8518>hanged<s%> is <S%H7045>accursed<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%>;) that thy <S%H127>land<s%> be not <S%H2930>defiled<s%>, which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> thee for an <S%H5159>inheritance<s%>.
